clinical_study.brief_title: Shifts in the Oral Biofilm of Patients With Known Oral Health Risk Factors
clinical_study.official_title: Shifts in the Oral Biofilm of Patients With Known Oral Health Risk Factors

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: This study is observational only and is intended to evaluate changes in the makeup and function of bacteria naturally present in the mouth during treatment with braces to straighten teeth.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Shannon diversity index from Baseline to Month 6
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Clusters Of Orthologous Groups of proteins

biospec_descr.textblock: bacteria isolated from plaque and saliva; human genome

study_pop.textblock: Patients entering and then undergoing orthodontic treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I or II (ASA I is a healthy patient, ASA II is patient with minor systemic disease)
- Patient must be receiving orthodontic treatment at the University of North Carolina School of Dentistry and not yet be in active treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have used antibacterial therapy in the past 3 months
- Patients who report current smoking
- ASA III or above (Patients with severe systemic diseases)
